title: Quiz of the week: Vinyl sales, Biden pranked and a dog's dinner
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Average house price hits record high of £255,000
description: Typical prices leap almost £24,000 since January, making the strongest year since 2006, Nationwide says.

title: Liverpool bomber made device with murderous intent, coroner says
description: Emad Al Swealmeen was killed when his homemade bomb went off outside Liverpool Women's Hospital.

title: 'I genuinely thought we had a good chance' - Anderson on England's Ashes defeat
description: England pace bowler James Anderson says he believed the side "genuinely had a good chance" of beating Australia in the Ashes.

title: Santander: Bank hands out £130m in Christmas blunder
description: The error meant around 75,000 people woke up on Christmas morning to a surprise payment from Santander.

title: Putin and Lukashenko team up for ice hockey match
description: The Russian and Belarusian leaders both made the scoreboard in a game following talks between the countries.

title: South Africa collapse as India win first Test
description: India wrap up a comfortable 113-run win over South Africa just after lunch on day five of the first Test.

title: What are the new Covid rules for the UK?
description: Covid rules have been strengthened in response to the Omicron variant.

title: China bans footballers from getting tattoos
description: Top players who already have body art are told to remove it, as a good example for society.

title: MMA fights we want to see in 2022
description: BBC Sport writers pick the MMA fights they want to see in 2022 - including Israel Adesanya v Kamaru Usman and Kayla Harrison v Cris Cyborg.

title: Media coverage disrespects Africa Cup of Nations - Wright
description: The Africa Cup of Nations is being "disrespected" by some negative media coverage, says former England striker Ian Wright.

title: Chelsea announce annual losses of £145m
description: Chelsea announce losses after tax of £145.6m for the year to 30 June 2021, despite their turnover increasing to £416.8m.

title: Ashraf Ghani: Ex-Afghan president describes moment he fled the Taliban
description: Speaking to the BBC, Ashraf Ghani tackles criticism he left Afghanistan as the Taliban closed in.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell guilty of helping Jeffrey Epstein abuse girls
description: A jury in New York convicts her of recruiting and trafficking teenagers in a "pyramid of abuse".

title: Covid: Nightingale surge hubs to be set up in eight hospitals, NHS England says
description: It comes as the UK saw record daily case numbers of 183,000 on Wednesday.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell: What the trial means for Prince Andrew
description: Ghislaine Maxwell has been convicted of grooming teenagers. What does this mean for her former friend?

title: Covid: Surge hospital hubs in England and warning of 'tsunami' of global cases
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Thursday morning.

title: The Papers: 'Guilty Ghislaine' and 'testing in tatters'
description: Thursday's front pages report Ghislaine Maxwell's conviction on sex trafficking charges in New York.

title: MND: Northampton mum determined to beat the odds
description: Emma Moss is determined to beat the odds, having been diagnosed with a fatal disease three years ago.

title: Digging for Britain: Secrets of Rutland Roman villa mosaic revealed
description: The stunning mosaic gives us clues to Britain's place in the wider Roman world, experts say.

title: Brexit: How has pet travel to EU countries been affected?
description: Changes to rules on travel to the EU with pets have led to higher bills and some problems for owners.

title: The drama of Peru's Covid orphans
description: A tragic effect of the pandemic is that thousands of children are now without a parent or guardian.

title: What does future warfare look like? It's here already
description: There's one area where the West is falling dangerously behind Russia and China - hypersonic missiles.

title: Your pictures of the year 2021
description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

title: Hong Kong: The last day of the Stand News pro-democracy website
description: From raids and arrests to the announcement of its closure, this is how its last day unfolded.

title: Why I switched to eating grandma's food
description: Many "forgotten foods" are returning to the farms and fields - and on our plates too.

title: Princess Diana: Files reveal plea for Elton John to perform at funeral
description: A top clergyman said a performance by Sir Elton would be "generous" for millions who felt bereaved.

title: The secret lives of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein
description: Never-before-seen photos released during her trial shed new light on their private lives.

title: What went wrong with vaccinating the world?
description: Why developed countries have a surplus of vaccines while low-income ones are still struggling to battle Covid.

title: Recycling the 'unrecyclable': How are hair salons going green?
description: Fry Taylor founded the Green Salon Collective which is encouraging sustainable working practices in the hairdressing industry.

title: COP 26: The teenagers suing 33 countries
description: To ensure the promises of COP26 are kept, young campaigners are putting their faith in the courts.

title: Syntropic agriculture: A new way of farming in dry climates?
description: Ernst Gotsch's method of agriculture increases, rather than decreases, biodiversity and wildlife.
